Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Sherd
Description: Sherd of a hemispherical bowl made with a coarse clay containing high quantities of organic temper. This bowl might have been used for cooking. Black clay with oxidised surfaces, therefore orange in colour. The surfaces were polished and XXX. This type of decoration appears on A-Group material until the beginning of the 2nd millennium B.C.
